qas.question: When did George W. Bush first say 'war on terrorism'?
Which word did George W. Bush apologize for using when talking about the war?
When did George W. Bush first say 'war on terror'?
Where did Bush say the 'war on terror' begins?
When did Bush say the 'war on terror' ends?

answers.text: every terrorist group of global reach has been found, stopped, and defeated

qas.question: What controversial term did George W. Bush use on 20 September 2001?
Where did George W. Bush give his 20 September 2001 address from?
What part of the government did George W. Bush address on 16 September 2001?
What day did George W. Bush apologize for the word crusade?
Where was Bush during the televised address?
Who protested the use of the word crusade?
What faith used the term "crusade" in reference to terrorism?
When was the second time Bush referred to the war as a crusade?

context: On <a0_0><b8_0>16 September 2001<b8_0/><a0_0/>, at <b6_0><b9_0>Camp David<b9_0/><b6_0/>, <b10_0>President George W. Bush<b10_0/> used the phrase war on terrorism in an unscripted and controversial comment when he said, "This <a1_0><b5_0>crusade<b5_0/><a1_0/> – this war on terrorism – is going to take a while, ... " Bush later apologized for this remark due to the negative connotations the term crusade has to people, e.g. of <b11_0>Muslim<b11_0/> faith. The word crusade was not used again. On <a2_0><b12_0>20 September 2001<b12_0/><a2_0/>, during a televised address to a <b7_0>joint session of congress<b7_0/>, Bush stated that, "(o)ur 'war on terror' begins <a3_0>with al-Qaeda<a3_0/>, but it does not end there. It will not end until <a4_0>every terrorist group of global reach has been found, stopped, and defeated<a4_0/>."
